module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies the definition of geometric items needed for constructing geometry or for defining geometric dimensional tolerances. It provides a collection of geometry that is used to support the definition of a geometric model. Construction geometry can be used in the definition of tolerance zones and dimensions of features of the model. The construction geometry can represent centres or tangents derived from the shape. In these cases the construction geometry will be the geometry of a derived geometry. Construction geometry refers directly or indirectly, via intermediate construction geometry or derived geometry to a geometric model.

inscope.li: geometric primitives of one and two dimensions; Points, lines, and planes are used to construct more complex geometry that represents the shape of products and features of products. Points, lines, and planes can represent the derived centres of ideal symmetric features of size found in product definitions. Points, curves, and surfaces can represent the derived centres of imperfect features of size measured on real workpieces.
